title: 14. Your company runs most of its compute workloads in Google Compute Engine in the europe-west1-b zone. Your operations team use Cloud Shell to manage these instances. They want to know if it is possible to designate a default compute zone and not supply the zone parameter when running each command in the CLI. What should you do?
alternatives: A. In GCP Console set europe-west1-! zone in the default location in Compute Engine Settings.
B. Run gcloud config to set europe-west1-b as the default zone.
C. Update the gcloud configuration file ~/config.ini to set europe-west1-b as the default zone.
D. Add a metadata entry in the Compute Engine Settings page with key: compute/zone and value: europe-west1-b.
